metadata.title: DSAT Practice Set (Modules 1 & 2)
metadata.directions: Answer each question. Select the best choice.

questions.prompt:
The table shows selected values from the function \( f \).
\(x\)\(f(x)\)
-1\(\tfrac{1}{50}\)
0\(1\)
1\(50\)
2\(2{,}500\)
Which of the following is the best description of function \( f \)?
questions.rationale: Values grow by a constant factor; exponential increase.

questions.prompt: The equation \( d = 37w + 100 \) gives the total amount of money \( d \), in dollars, that Janna plans to save \( w \) weeks after she starts to save. What is \( d \) in 10 weeks?
What value of \( n \) solves \( 9n - 10 = 2n + 25 \)?
Solve for \( x \): \( x^2 - 2 = 23 \). Which value is a solution?
The function \( f(x) = 7x + 9 \) gives the estimated height, in feet, of a poplar tree \( x \) years after its height was first measured. Which is the best interpretation of \(9\)?
choices: The tree will be measured each year for 9 years.
The tree is estimated to grow to a maximum height of 9 feet.
The estimated height of the tree increased by 9 feet each year.
The estimated height of the tree was 9 feet when it was first measured.

questions.prompt: The perimeter of a square is expressed as \(4(76)\) units. What is the side length?
Sonja bought a laptop for \(\$1{,}000\) and its value decreases by \(2\%\) each month for \(50\) months. Which equation models the value \(v\) (in dollars) after \(m\) months, where \(m\le 50\)?
In triangle \(FGH\), the measure of angle \(F\) is \(63^{\circ}\). Which additional fact is sufficient to prove \(\triangle FGH\) is right?
choices: The sum of \(F, G, H\) is \(180^{\circ}\).

questions.prompt:
![Parallel lines diagram](./img/m1q9.png)

In the figure, line \(r\) is parallel to line \(s\). What is the value of \(x\)?
The equation \( 11m = 7(n+p) \) relates positive numbers \( m, n, p \). Which equation gives \( n \) in terms of \( m \) and \( p \)?

A survey of daily commuting times (in minutes) of seven Chicago employees yielded \(31,13,44,32,53,22,44\). Seven San Francisco employees yielded \(46,31,19,33,48, x, 38\). If the means are equal, what is \(x\)?
questions.rationale: Equal means ⇒ equal sums (7 data each). Chicago sum=239, so 215+x=239 ⇒ x=24.

questions.prompt: Which expression is equivalent to \(5xy + 30x^2y + 35xy^2\)?
A poll estimates \(40\%\) support with margin of error \(\pm6\%\). Which conclusion is most appropriate?
choices: Support is either less than \(34\%\) or more than \(46\%\).

questions.prompt: A perennial is classified as tall if its height \(h\) (cm) when fully grown is more than \(100\). Which inequality represents possible \(h\) for a tall species?
Simplify \((2x^2 + 3x - 3) - (7x^2 + 2x)\). The result is \(-5x^2 + ax - 3\). What is \(a\)?
Kinetic energy \(K=\tfrac{1}{2}mv^2\). If also \(K=98v^2\), what is the mass \(m\) (kg)?

![Subscriber growth graph](./img/m1q17.png)

A graph models subscribers at the end of each 6‑month period; \(x\) is the number of 6‑month periods since January 1995. Which best interprets the point \((1,600)\)?
choices: At the end of the first 6‑month period, subscribers were about 600.
Subscribers at the end of January 1995 were 600.
Subscribers at the end of January 1996 were 600.

questions.prompt:
The table summarizes the number of objects.
GroupNumber of objects
A325
B64
C611
D96
Total1,096
The number in group C is \(p\%\) of the number in group A. Find \(p\).
Solve the system \(\tfrac{1}{4}(s+4t)=544\) and \(7s-8t=1192\). Find \(s-t\).
questions.rationale: From ¼(s+4t)=544 ⇒ s+4t=2176 and 7s−8t=1192. Solving gives s=616, t=390, so s−t=226.

questions.prompt:
![Line k](./img/m1q20.png)

Line \(k\) is shown. Line \(j\) is perpendicular to \(k\) and passes through \((7,15)\). What is the \(y\)‑intercept of line \(j\)?
questions.rationale: Using slope from the diagram and point form yields \(b=-\tfrac{47}{4}\).

questions.prompt:
For linear function \(r\),
\(x\)\(r(x)\)
-41-6
-210
-16
If \(r(x)=ax+b\), find \(a+b\).
System \(y=-3x^2-40\) and \(y=qx-37\) intersects at exactly one point. What is \(x\) at the intersection?
**[Needs image]** Which table gives three values of \(x\) and their corresponding values of \(y\) for \(\tfrac{2}{5}x+\tfrac{2}{3}y=5\)?
questions.rationale: Requires the table image (./img/m2q6.png). Only one table will satisfy the linear relation for all three pairs.

questions.prompt: Ari examined 86 plants with masses between \(2.8\) and \(6.3\) kg. Chihiro examined the same 86 plus one of mass \(11.6\) kg. Which must be true?
choices: Ari's set has greater standard deviation.
questions.rationale: Adding a large value increases the mean.

questions.prompt: In the system \(3x+9y=10\) and \(rx+18y=20\), for infinitely many solutions what is \(r\)?
questions.rationale: Multiply the first equation by 2 to match coefficients.

questions.prompt: Right triangle \(ABC\) has right angle at \(B\). If \(AB=10\sqrt{41}\) and \(BC=24\sqrt{41}\), find \(AC\).
A model \(m(t)=-0.0274\big(\tfrac{t}{7}\big)^2+7.3873\big(\tfrac{t}{7}\big)+75.032\). Which best interprets \(m(140)\approx 212\)?
Rectangles \(ABCD\) and \(EFGH\) are similar; each side of \(EFGH\) is \(10\times\) each side of \(ABCD\). If area of \(ABCD\) is \(140\), find the area of \(EFGH\).
A machine makes parts: 8‑inch parts \(=3n\), 5‑inch parts \(=n\), and 7‑inch parts \(=12\). Total parts are \(100\). Which equation represents this?
Solve \(2+\tfrac{1-x}{2}=\tfrac{-2(1-x)}{3}\). What is \(1-x\)?
Speed increases at \(1490\) meters per hour each second. Convert to feet per second squared. (\(1\,\text{m}=3.28\,\text{ft}\))
Which equation has no solution?
Let \( f(x)=(x-a)(x-b) \) with integers \(a,b\). If \( f(32)>0\), \( f(35)<0\), \( f(38)>0\), which could be \(a+b\)?
questions.rationale: Roots straddle 35, symmetric sum near 70; choice \(69\).

questions.prompt: One gallon of sealant costs \(\$13\) and covers \(300\,\text{ft}^2\). A deck has area \(d\,\text{ft}^2\). Two coats are needed. Which equation gives the cost \(c\)?
The equation \(\sqrt{k-x}=42-x\) has exactly one real solution. What is the minimum value of \(4k\)?
Given \(26z^{18}+bz^9+70\) and \(qz^9+r\) is a factor (\(q,r\in\mathbb{Z}^+\)), what is the greatest possible \(b\)?
questions.rationale: Max when \(q=26, A=1, r=1, B=70\Rightarrow b=26\cdot70+1=1821\).

questions.prompt: In isosceles \(\triangle ABC\) with \(AB=AC\), \(BD=\tfrac{2}{7}BC\). Points \(E\in AB\), \(F\in AC\) satisfy \(\angle BED=\angle CFD\). If \(BE=14\), find \(CF\).
On the unit circle, \(A(1,0)\) and \(B\big(-\tfrac{5}{\sqrt{89}},\tfrac{8}{\sqrt{89}}\big)\). If \(\angle AOB=\omega\), compute \(\tan\omega\).
Given \(x(kx-112)=-8\) with integer \(k\), for two distinct real solutions find the greatest \(k\).
